byline.contributor: Helene Cooper reported from Washington, and Richard A. Oppel Jr. from Boston.
byline.original: By HELENE COOPER and RICHARD A. OPPEL Jr

abstract: United States Army charges Sgt Bowe Bergdahl with misbehavior before the enemy and desertion; Bergdahl, who left his post in Afghanistan in 2009 and was later held captive by Haqqani insurgents for five years, was released in a trade with five Taliban detainees in 2014.
lead_paragraph: The charges for Sgt. Bowe Bergdahl, who was held captive in Afghanistan, raised the possibility that he could be imprisoned again, this time for life.

headline.main: Bowe Bergdahl Charged With Desertion and Misbehavior Before the Enemy
headline.print_headline: Soldier Released by Taliban Is Charged by U.S. as Deserter

snippet: The charges for Sgt. Bowe Bergdahl, who was held captive in Afghanistan, raised the possibility that he could be imprisoned again, this time for life.

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
